member.summary: Prints the stack of errors, then clears them.

The ModContentPack of the active mod.

member.summary: Prints the stack of errors, then clears them.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.PatchOperationSafe.ContainsNode(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Checks if a node somtains another node. Checks names and potentially attributes. XmlDocument doesn't matter.
member.param: The node whose children you want check
The node that will be checked against
member.returns: Whether or not the node contains the given node

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Helpers.GetPrefix(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the prefix the given length.

The number of nodes that appear in the xpath.
member.returns: The prefix.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Helpers.SubstituteVariable(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Substitutes a variable with its value in a given a string.
member.param: The string that you want to edit.
The name of the variable.
The value of the variable.
The left and right brackets that surround the variable.
member.returns: The new string after the substitution.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Helpers.SubstituteVariables(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Substitutes a list of variables with their corresponding values in a given string.
member.param: The string that you want to edit.
The list of variable names.
The list of values for the variables.
The left and right brackets that surround the variables.
member.returns: The new string after the substitution.

member.summary: Substitutes a variable with its value in a given XmlContainer.
member.param: The XmlContainer that you want to edit.
The name of the variable.
The value of the variable.
The left and right brackets that surround the variable.
member.returns: The new XmlContainer after the substitution.

member.param: The string that you want to edit.
The list of variable names.
The list of values for the variables.
The left and right brackets that surround the variables.

member.summary: Creates a PatchOperation from its OuterXml.

member.returns: A PatchOperation from the given OuterXml.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Helpers.OperationOnString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs a mathematical on two strings.
member.param: The first string.
The second string.
The operation to be performed.
member.returns: The resulting string.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Helpers.RelationOnString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes a binary relation between two strings.
member.param: The first string.
The second string.
The binary relation.
If true, then the inputs will be interpreted as strings and dictionary order is used instead.
member.returns: Whether or not the relations holds.

member.summary: Throws an error for the patch operation
member.param: The message to be displayed

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.Initialize(System.String,XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer)
member.summary: This method will be run exactly one time after the game finishes booting and after running DefaultValue(), it is used to initialize the setting
member.returns: Returns false if there was an error, true otherwise

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.DrawSetting(UnityEngine.Rect,System.String)
member.summary: Draw the setting in the given Rect
member.param: The Rect that the setting will be drawn in
The modId of the active mod in the settings menu

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.SetDefaultValue(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the defaultValue of this setting, it is run immediately after the game finishes loading
You may skip this if your setting doesn't contain other settings, or doesn't require a special method
member.returns: Returns false if there was an error, true otherwise

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.Init(System.String)
member.summary:
This method will be run exactly one time after the game finishes booting and after running SetDefaultValue()
You may run any initialization or pre-computation code here
member.returns: Return false if there was an error, true otherwise.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.DrawSettingContents(UnityEngine.Rect,System.String)
member.summary: Draw the setting in the given Rect
member.param: The Rect that the setting will be drawn in
The modId of the active mod in the settings menu

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.GetDefaultSpacing
member.summary: Gets the defaultSpacing of the currently open SettingsMenuDef.
member.returns: The spacing of the current SettingsMenuDef.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.SetActiveMenu(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the currently displayed menu to the one given
member.param: the defName of the SettingsMenuDef you want to display

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.DrawSettingsList(UnityEngine.Rect,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer})
member.summary: Draws a list of SettingsContainer, error handling is done automatically
member.param: The Rect to draw in, should be the same height as the height of the list of settings
The modId of the selected mod in the menu
The list of settings to draw

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.CalculateHeightSettingsList(System.Single,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer})
member.summary: Calculates the total height of every setting in the list
member.param: The width of the column the settings will be placed in
The modId of the active mod in the settings menu
The list of settings
member.returns: The total height of the settings

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer.InitializeSettingsList(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{XmlExtensions.Setting.SettingContainer},System.String)
member.summary:
Applies the Init() method on every setting in the list, error handling done automatically
If the name of the list is provided, it will be used for error reporting
member.param: The modId of the active mod in the settings menu
The list of settings
The name of the list (for error reporting purposes)
member.returns: Returns false if there was an error, true otherwise

member.name: T:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager
member.summary: This class contains methods to access settings that XML Extensions manages

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.GetDefaultValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the defaultValue of a given setting.
member.param: The modId of your mod
The key of the setting
member.returns: The defaultValue of the setting associated with the given key

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.SetDefaultValue(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the defaultValue of a setting to the value given
member.param: The modId of your mod
The key of the setting
The value you want to set as default

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.GetSetting(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the current value of a setting.
member.param: The modId of your mod.
The key of the setting you want to access.
member.returns: The current value associated with the given key.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.TryGetSetting(System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the value of a given setting, and stores it into value.
member.param: The modId of your mod.
The key of the setting.
The reference of the variable you want to store the value in.
member.returns: Whether or not a value was found for the key.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.SetSetting(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the given value to the key. The settings will be saved via Scribe as soon as the user closes the "More Mod Settings" menu.
member.param: The modId of your mod.
The key of the setting.
The value you want to store.

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.ContainsKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the given mod has a setting associated with the given key
member.param: The modId of your mod
The key of the setting you want to check
member.returns: true if the mod contains the key, false otherwise

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.GetKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Iterator for all active keys associated with the given mod
member.param: The modId of the mod
member.returns: An iterator for every active key associated with the given mod

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.DeleteSetting(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the setting and key for the given mod
member.param: The modId of the mod
The key you want to delete

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.RegisterKey(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers the key-value pair into XML Extensions settings database
member.param: The modId of the mod
The key you want to delete
The potential value to register

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.AddMod(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Register a new mod into XML Extensions, only use if you know what you are doing
member.param: The modId of the new mod
The label of the new mod

member.name: M:XmlExtensions.SettingsManager.AddMod(System.String)
member.summary: Register a new mod into XML Extensions, only use if you know what you are doing
member.param: The modId of the new mod
